categories.title: Eliza OS Recent Updates and Improvements

content.text:
# New Features and Enhancements

## Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Integrations
- Added CoinGecko price per address functionality (PR #2262)
- Added support for gravity chain in EVM plugin (PR #2228)
- Added AGW support to the Abstract plugin (PR #2207)
- Implemented Gitcoin passport integration (PR #2296)
- Added BÂ² Network plugin (PR #2010)
- Implemented EVM OpenZeppelin governance plugin (PR #1710)
- Added cross chain swaps through Squid Router (PR #1482)
- Added birdeye plugin for Solana token data (PR #1417)

## User Experience Improvements
- Merged Eliza Installer with the current start.sh script (PR #2229)
- Added character creation template function to start.sh (PR #2232)
- Added Direct Client API with Delete Agent functionality (PR #2267)
- Added limit parameter to memory retrieval across adapters (PR #2264)
- Added an example service (PR #2249)

## Documentation Updates
- Added Farsi (Persian) readme (PR #2260)
- Added "What Did You Get Done This Week? #9" notes (PR #2243)
- Added weekly contributor meeting notes (PR #2285)

# Bug Fixes
- Fixed IME causing multiple messages on Enter (PR #2274)
- Fixed derive key and updated remote attestation (PR #2303)
- Fixed missing @elizaos/plugin-b2 (PR #2268)
- Fixed test/lint develop issues (PR #2266)
- Fixed typo in README.md (PR #2256)
- Resolved Windows path issue in pnpm build client (PR #2240)

# Other Changes
- Reverted "Add support for VoyageAI embeddings API" (PR #2290)
- Fixed export of b2Plugin (PR #2291)
- Added plugin for TEE verifiable log (PR #1369)
- Minor typo fix in CHANGELOG.md (PR #2255)

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several technical issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository, covering a range of problems:

1. Authentication issues: Twitter authentication is failing on Cloud with Error 399 (#2225).

2. Missing dependencies: The '@anush008/tokenizers-linux-arm64-gnu' module is missing (#2242).

3. Data retrieval problems: The getRecentPostInteractions function is returning all memory instead of just recent interactions (#2253).

4. Deployment issues: Client-direct v0.1.8 failed to deploy to npm, causing inconsistencies (#2227).

5. Runtime errors: Users are encountering various errors including 'Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'useState')' (#2226), Wasm SIMD unsupported compilation errors when running pnpm start (#2279), and crashes with 'Exit status 7' when using Postgres (#2306).

6. Content limitations: Tweets are being cut off, with users looking for ways to adjust tweet length (#2277).

7. Integration problems: The farcaster-client is failing to embed (#2302).

8. Hardware configuration questions: Users are seeking guidance on running Eliza locally with two graphical cards (#2304).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests to elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new features and improvements have been proposed to the elizaOS/eliza repository through recent pull requests. These include:

1. Twitter integration features:
   - A Twitter follow feature (PR #2224)
   - NFT opportunities tweet functionality (PR #2297)

2. Blockchain and cryptocurrency support:
   - NEAR Protocol Intents implementation (PR #2244)
   - Tron blockchain plugin for bridge, swap, and transfer operations (PR #2275)
   - BNB chain support through plugin-bnb (PR #2278)
   - NFT thin floor opportunities feature (PR #2289)

3. Technical improvements:
   - ARM64 fastembed support (PR #2259)
   - Plugin for tee-verifiable-log (PR #1369)
   - Fix for the Supabase adapter (PR #2258)

These pull requests demonstrate ongoing development to enhance social media integration, expand blockchain support, and improve technical capabilities of the Eliza platform.

Current cryptocurrency prices show fluctuations across major tokens. WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) is trading between $3,135.31 and $3,265.05, showing some volatility. SOL (Solana) is priced between $182.77 and $188.38. WBTC (Wrapped Bitcoin) remains relatively stable around $94,335-$94,351. The ai16z token shows more significant relative movement, ranging from $1.06 to $1.13.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 13-14, 2025, there were 27 new pull requests with 7 merged, 12 new issues created, and 66 active contributors. The following day (January 14-15, 2025) saw increased PR activity with 34 new pull requests and a higher merge rate of 20 PRs, while new issues decreased to 7. The active contributor count remained relatively stable, with a slight decrease from 66 to 63 contributors.
